Articles.Content: We are all familiar with the 'six degrees of separation' theory? Well, in a book I am currently reading the author proposes a 'handshake' theory. The idea is, you shake the hand of a famous person who has shaken the hand of another famous person, and that puts you one handshake away from the other famous person. A few years ago I very briefly met and shook hands with Buzz Aldrin, so I guess that means I am one handshake away from Neil Armstrong!
Huh? And what does this have to do with KSP?
I'd be ecstatic to meet any Apollo astronaught. Unfiortunately they don't make their way down this side of the globe all that often.

This sounds like something for the Space Lounge. Moving there.

Sadly, I can't say I've shaken hands with anyone who's ever shaken hands directly with an astronaut. I did hold a brief conversation with a store owner whose father worked as a technician at one of the NASA facilities back in the '60s, however, so I might be at least two handshakes away from one if he ever shook hands directly with an astronaut.

Huh? And what does this have to do with KSP?

Nothing. That's why he posted on the space lounge.

We are all familiar with the 'six degrees of separation' theory? Well, in a book I am currently reading the author proposes a 'handshake' theory. The idea is, you shake the hand of a famous person who has shaken the hand of another famous person, and that puts you one handshake away from the other famous person. A few years ago I very briefly met and shook hands with Buzz Aldrin, so I guess that means I am one handshake away from Neil Armstrong!

And surely also 1 handshake away from several american presidents and their wives

I had the honour to meet german astronaut Ulf Merbold, who had the honour of flying into space with John Young: According to this theory I'm one handshake away from John Young and probably two from the rest of the Gemini and Apollo astronauts.
